scene_metadata.title: The Wisdom of Not Chasing
scene_metadata.philosophical_depth: living as myth rather than chasing mystical

dialogue.action: shows a gesture to slow down
dialogue.text: If this were myth —and it is, by the way— the next step wouldn't be to chase the door. It would be to listen.

psychological_notes: The architect reframes Evan's experience as living myth, not past event. The wisdom of not chasing represents a crucial psychological shift from grasping to receiving. By slowing down and listening, we allow the mystical to find us rather than exhausting ourselves in pursuit.
philosophical_underpinning: Life is already mythical; recognition requires receptivity not pursuit
therapeutic_direction: Shifting from active seeking to receptive awareness
